section: Exercise 5.9.1: Independence of events - random permutations.
instructions: A wedding party of eight people is lined up in a random order. Every way of lining up the people in the wedding party is equally likely.
question:
(b)

What is the probability that the maid of honor is in the leftmost position?
answer: Once the maid of honor is placed in the leftmost position, there are 7! ways to order the rest of the people, so the probability that the maid of honor is in the leftmost position is 7!/8! = 1/8.
